title: Overload or Opportunity? Living, Working and Innovating in the Age of Big Data
abstract:
Information overload is nothing new, but what about the prospect of Innovation overload? In the age of Big Data our ability to keep up with the unrelenting pace of change and innovation will be challenged in ways we can't even begin to imagine.  Our behaviors, experiences, identities, and nearly every aspect of our lives will become part of a vast real-time repository in the cloud, creating limitless opportunities for innovation. How will we harness the power of Big Data? How will it redefine your business and your job? And what about the disruptive role of the Cloud and Social Media? It's an overwhelming mixture of changes, but it's also an opportunity to reshape the way we innovate in business and society, perhaps enabling us to tackle some of the world's biggest problems. Join Tom as he takes us on a journey through this new landscape and new generation of behaviors and expectations about how we collaborate, work, play, and experience the world.
 
Tom Koulopoulos, leader, futurist, and author of nine business books on the intersection of business and technology, including his latest book Cloud Surfing, is uniquely qualified to help us understand the impact of technology. His perspectives, according to the late Peter Drucker, challenge you to not only rethink the way your run your business but also the way you run yourself.

speakers.bio:
Tom Koulopoulos is President and founder of The Delphi Group, past Executive Director of the Center for Business Innovation at Babson College, and past Managing Director of one of the service industry's first global Innovation Labs. Tom is the also the author of seven books, a lecturer at the Boston College Graduate school of Management, and a frequent contributor to national and international print and broadcast media. He has also been named one of the industry's six most influential consultants, according to InformationWeek. 
As one of the industry's most prolific thought leaders his insights provide a beyond-the-edge view of the turbulence created by the collision of technology and business. Tom Peters has called Tom's writing, "a brilliant vision of where we must take our enterprises to survive and thrive." The late management guru and 20th Century business icon, Peter Drucker, said of Tom's writings "[it]makes you question not only the way you run your business but the way you run yourself." 
In his book, The Innovation Zone, Tom takes readers beyond the glitz of the latest gadgets to explore the methods, tools, and behaviors needed to develop innovation as a core competency and generate the highest market value for the business, respect for the brand, and long-term competitive dominance. 
Mr. Koulopoulos has also been the Executive Director of the Center for Business Innovation at Babson College, an adjunct professor at the Boston College Wallace E. Carroll Graduate School of Management and a guest lecturer at the Boston University School of management and Harvard University. 
His philanthropic interests include being an early advisor to the non-profit Tech Foundation, which makes technology accessible to the non-profit sector in an attempt to bridge the widening digital divide and an active member of the non-profit Destination Imagination program which teaches creative problem solving and innovation skills to K-12 students worldwide.
